id.description: The unique identifier of the chat invitation. This is used to identify the invitation in the system. It is a primary key in the database. It is also used to reference the invitation in other models.

chatId.description: The foreign key to the chat entity to which this invitation belongs. This is used to associate the invitation with the correct chat. It is a foreign key to the Chat model.

chatName.description: The name of the chat to which the user is invited. This is used to display the chat name in the user interface.

message.description: The message that is sent with the chat invitation. This is used to provide context or information about the invitation. It can include details about the chat or a personal message to the user.

userId.description: The unique identifier of the user who is invited to the chat. This is used to identify the user in the system. It is a foreign key to the User model.

status.description: The status of the chat invitation. This is used to track whether the invitation is pending, accepted, or rejected.

createdAt.description: The timestamp when the invitation was created. This is used to track when the invitation was sent.

createdBy.description: Unique identifier of the user who created the invitation. This is used to track who sent the invitation. It is a foreign key to the User model.

id.description: The unique identifier of the attachment

type.description: The type that hints how the attachment can be displayed

id.description: The unique identifier of the message

createdAt.description: The date the message was created

owner.description: The unique identifier of the user who sent the message

chatId.description: The unique identifier of the chat to which this message belongs

createdAt.description: The date the chat was created

participants.description: A list of participants in the chat
